1.text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

2.text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

3.text: Without natural affection, truce breakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

4.text: Traitors, heady, high minded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

5.text: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

6.text: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,

7.text: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

8.text: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

9.text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest to all men, as theirs also was.

10.text: But you have fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, long-suffering, charity, patience,

11.text: Persecutions, afflictions, which came to me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.

12.text: Yes, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

13.text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

14.text: But continue you in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing of whom you have learned them;

15.text: And that from a child you have known the holy scriptures, which are able to make you wise to salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

16.text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

17.text: That the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished to all good works.
